alert.note: Alert for Kittson; West Marshall; West Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 17 at 4:07AM CDT until March 17 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Blowing snow and snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Minnesota and northeast and southeast North Dakota. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 9 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility with isolated blizzard conditions where falling snow is occurring. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Northern valley out of town travel will be the area with the most difficult travel conditions with isolated whiteouts and blizzard conditions possible when light snow occurs.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at travel.dot.nd.gov and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
